definition[0]: used to introduce a statement that makes your main statement seem surprising or unlikely
example[0]: Although in poor health, she continued to carry out her duties.
example[1]: We decided to take rooms in Longwood House, although we knew we could not really afford the rent.
example[2]: Although I can’t help admiring the man’s courage, I do not approve of his methods.
definition[1]: used to add a statement that balances or reduces the effect of what you have just said
example[3]: You can copy down my answers, although I’m not sure they’re right.
example[4]: No, this is my responsibility, although I appreciate your offer.
